Based on your preferences, I would recommend "Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix" (2003) to you.

The movie follows Harry Potter as he navigates through the challenges of being a student at Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry.

One of the key themes of the movie is the power of friendship. Harry's closest friends, Ron Weasley and Hermione Granger, provide him with much-needed support throughout his journey at Hogwarts.

Another important theme in the movie is the importance of courage. Harry must face numerous challenges and obstacles during his time at Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry.

One such challenge that Harry faces is when he is forced to participate in a rather sinister and dangerous ritual known as "Sorcerer's Stone".

This challenging and daunting task that Harry must undertake during his time at Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry is one of the key themes of the movie, and it serves as a reminder to us all about the importance of courage in our lives.
